articles.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse to Celebrate 132nd Birthday with Open House on Jan. 17

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston Police arrested 21-year-old Lucas Brent Carr of Roseburg on 60 charges of encouraging child sex abuse in the first degree. Police said the case began July 16, 2025, after a tip from the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children. Carr is held without bail.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Jailed on 60 Child Sex Abuse Charges After Winston Police Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Elk Island Trading Group dismissed its lawsuit against the City of Roseburg, citing a possible path forward through changes to the Homeless Commission and a focus on Parker’s Place Village in Grants Pass, expected to open June 1, 2026.
articles.title: Elk Island Drops Lawsuit Against City of Roseburg, Citing “Path Forward” and Grants Pass Shelter Focus

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Jan. 14, including criminal trespass and warrant arrests, a vehicle break-in theft, weapons ordinance violations in the Greenway, and multiple non-injury crashes, according to the city’s daily police log.
articles.title: Police Log: January 14, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg residents are invited to volunteer Monday for the annual MLK Day of Service river cleanup and invasive species removal event. Crews will work in several city parks, with a 9 a.m. gathering at Stewart Park Pavilion.
articles.title: Community Invited to MLK Day of Service River Cleanup and Restoration in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg High School students will soon train on the Umpqua Community College campus after both boards approved a new partnership. The agreement creates dedicated space in UCC’s Medical Careers Hub, opening new healthcare career pathways for local students.
articles.title: Roseburg High Students to Gain Hands-On Healthcare Training at UCC Through New Partnership

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: January 15, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A multi jurisdictional training exercise simulating a train car hazardous materials incident will take place in downtown Roseburg on February 10. Residents may see increased emergency activity. This is only a drill and there is no threat to the public.
articles.title: Multi Jurisdictional Training Exercise Planned in Downtown Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police cited a 56 year old man after finding a fire burning inside a tent at a Deer Creek Park campsite. Officers also located a machete at the scene. The man was cited for prohibited burning and possessing prohibited weapons on city property.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Cited After Fire and Weapon Found at Deer Creek Park Campsite

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations on Jan. 13, including parole and warrant arrests, prohibited camping enforcement, littering near waterways, and traffic violations. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections following citywide contacts.
articles.title: Police Log: January 13, 2026

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Roseburg Schools and Umpqua Community College (UCC) are poised to enhance healthcare career pathways with a $2.5 million investment.
articles.title: Roseburg-UCC project expands healthcare career paths for students
